reviews.review_msg: Very nice prof, he really cares about teaching and will help you if you needed help.

Professor Leavitt was amazing! He has a true passion for psychology, which is clear by the way he speaks about the lecture content. He is kind and available after class to help with any topics you are unclear about. His exams are very easy and based almost entirely on the lecture slides, so I wouldn't bother buying the textbook. 10/10, no notes!

Super easy class! Assignments are fairly easy they are basically used as grade boosters. Lots of chances for bonus marks. Exams are short and easy. The written portion of the exam, the topic is given to you prior. Overall, such a grade booster class and attendance nor is reading the textbook needed to get a good grade.

I love Peter yall he's really straightforward and everything on his lectures are on the test; there's no curveballs or anything unexpected of the sort. He clearly outlines his expectations and all you have to do is follow them- they're really easy to follow. Amazing down to earth guy.

Where do I begin? Petes is the real deal. Super caring, responds to emails fast, and always happy to clear up any confusion. Exam-wise, they were on the easier side, and he let you know what the written question subject would be. Excluding the APA assignment, the written assignment was engaging and not that long (~1000 words over the semester).

Peter is an understanding and caring prof. This was my first psychology course and I'm now looking to pursue it as a major because of his inspiration! The way he taught the PSYC 100 was pretty straightforward and his lectures were interesting. If you want to or need to take a psyc class, take it with him!!

I think honestly, this is an assignment heavy class which should not be surprising because it is a writing class lol. Other than that, I think everything was quite fair because he gives a bunch of assignments and the final paper is only 20% of your mark. He was super easy to reach, and I think if you put in effort you will do great!

300 with Dr. Leavitt was amazing! People say the course is hard, but his first time teaching it went so well. Grading is super fair as there's lots of small easy assignments, and final paper's only 20%! Attendance is mandatory, but tutorials with TA Samantha Mason are the best, she lets you leave an hour early and is hilarious. Highly recommend!

I crammed the entire thing overnight and still got a B so... No excuses guys. He's pretty funny from like the 2 times I talked to him. Also you SHOULD keep up with the lectures because there is a research report to write... Since it's his first time hosting 201W some parts were rough and not clear, but he fixed those mistakes.
Dr Leavitt was absolutely phenomenal. Very approachable, kind, respectable, and wants you to succeed. Every assignment and the final is fair. Don't need to read textbook, his slides cover it all.

Dr. Leaving was a great prof! If im being honest i only attended one lecture and still ended up w a great mark! His tests are so easy- you don't really need the textbook since his lectures cover everything, but just make sure you study the slides throughly and you'll do fine. A big paper at the end too! Otherwise loved the class

Lectures were really boring. I found it more effective to stay at home and read the textbook and take notes off of that. I liked his writing assignments though, it was straight forward and an easy garde booster.

Dr. Leavitt is awesome. His lectures are entertaining and comprehensive and he posts slides so if you can't attend its fine. We a group project, but the final research report on the group project was individual, so your not totally screwed if you get bad group members. The final was super fair too, he wants students to do well and won't trick you.

Professor Leavitt was honestly one of the nicest profs I think I've ever had. I took PSYC 100 as an elective and just to try it, and he was such a caring and easygoing teacher. Everyone was mean to him in his lectures because he's too nice, he deserves so much more credit for how patient he is. His grading is super fair, and he is awesome.

Amazing, he was literally an angel. Exams were so easy I would be shocked after every one of them. The only thing I did to prepare for exams was read the textbook, and I ended up with a 98 in the class. Also, for 2 of the exams, he decided some questions were "too hard," so he gave everyone points. Take this class if you want a great GPA booster!!!

Probably the best prof I've had at SFU so far. He's so nice and always replies to emails. His exams are also really fair and they're exactly like the ppt slides. This class is a great gpa booster I highly recommend taking psyc 100 with him.
Overall, he is an amazing prof. Lectures are a bit lengthy but thorough and straightforward. He truly cares and follows through on feedback.

didn't even go to all the classes, memorized lectures and read the textbook and ur set for exams. Bro is acc the GOAT. He's so nice and helpful and cares about his students and wants to make life as easy as possible for them. Definitely take him if you need psyc 100 but rmbr to work hard for the writing assignments and write clearly and in APA

his lectures are based off the textbook but you need to read the texbook for exams and quizzes. Memorize the lectures and read the textbook and you should be fine. He replies to emails even on weekends and is super helpful even during the actual exam when you ask for help. His exams are scenerio based questions that are really easy to understand.

Know how to write clearly and LEARN APA for this class. Peter makes such nice exams . They are straightforward and directly from lectures but he will throw in some small things from the textbook. READ THE TEXTBOOK FOR THE MIDTERMS YALL Majority of it is from lectures. Quizzes u gotta study but not horrible. Bro might be the best psyc prof yet

Dr. Leavitt is by far the best professor I've had at Sfu. He's so kind, his lectures were always super clear and very helpful for exams. He's also always happy to help and actually legitimately wants to support his students in every way. Never hesitate to take anything psych courses with him if you have the chance.

Dr Leavitt is my favourite prof I have ever had!! He is so kind, gives amazing and clear feedback, and replies to emails and questions so quick, he clearly cares about his students. He doesn't over talk or yap, just enough to understand. Tests were super fair and not difficult! Overall HIGHLY recommend him as a psych prof, he is amazing!!!

Dr Leavitt was very approachable and good at engaging the class during lectures. The exams were always reasonable, though the final paper had somewhat unclear instructions. Overall, a good experience.

Lectures stick to the textbook with little elaboration (except on AI). Exams are easy but occasionally tricky due to wording on 1-2 written questions. While he's passionate about teaching and engages students, discussions sometimes go off-topic. Overall, he's a solid choice for first-year students since he's straightforward and understanding.

Great prof, lectures are simple and interesting. The no midterms or finals, just an exam per 4 units. He is very understanding and as long as you are honest and reach out for help in time, he will do what he can. Make sure to read your chapters weekly, it will help. The chapters are pretty long but detailed, the textbook is not difficult to read.

I am currently taking my second class with this professor; he has been excellent so far. He is clearly very passionate about what he is teaching, which is difficult to find with introductory courses. There is a lot of reading in his class but that can be said for any introductory psychology or social sciences class.

Dr. Leavitt engages with students during lectures, makes them a little more interesting, and shows he cares about his students. his slides highlight what will be on the exams but mainly if you read the textbook and study, it shouldn't be hard to do well on the exams. he's pretty clear about what will be on the exams & there aren't any surprises.

Nice guy,lectures are boring. Just read the textbook/notes and you will do good on the exam. Attend the review days he will sometimes mention/hint what some of the short answer questions will be. Obsessed with AI.

He cares for his students and is passionate! Tedious lectures, though he tries his best to engage the class and take feedback. I studied off the textbook for in-depth learning, however, you can probably survive just off the slides. Going to lectures can help but skipping and studying on your own is more time efficient. Overall, recommend 👍
Really nice professor, if you read the textbook the class is easy.  The TAs didn't grade very well, but if you email them they'll always find extra points to give you, so it's a bit suggestive.

the class layout is amazing and very simple. 3 tests, non cumulative, each consisting of 2-3 chapters. Lectures were very boring and the slides are very weirdly worded so id recommend asking chat gpt to reword them into simpler terms. Also lock in for the writing assignment, that's where u can lose marks. Def a gpa booster class.

Dr. Leavitt spoke passionately about the topics. The textbook was straightforward but the chapters were really long (around 50-80 pages). There was no final, just 3 exams with MC and short answers. The content was not hard to understand, but what made it hard was how much content was covered. Just read the textbook and you'll do fine.

For the written portions, the TAs were very vague in the feedback and it was toughly graded. Midterms were fair with a few multiple choice being too difficult. He was very passionate and wanted to hear from everyone!

Although reading your textbook is not mandatory, his slides are really condensed. So reading the textbook is really good to clarify some theories especially since his exams can be confusing as they go beyond than just what he says they (the exam topics) are on. There are weekly quizzes that I found to be great grade boosters. Great prof though!

The lectures are long, but prof is passionate so it helps. Tests are straightforward and textbook is long (but useful). TA's, hard markers with no feedback. Weekly quizzes helps with reviewing material. The paper was reasonably lengthed and quite short compared to other courses. Great prof and definitely recommend if you want/need to take PSYC100!

He talks a lot during lectures and often goes off topic so we don't finish reviewing the slides. Sometimes, he chats with the students with questions for a long time and not finish the slides either. Other than that, he's really nice and offered to mark easy because of confusing exam questions!

He's a nice guy but lectures are extremely boring. He never elaborates on his notes and moves fast "just go back and read on your own time." His exams are easy and are based off his notes/textbook but were sometimes worded really weirdly and he would have to give us bonus marks for his mistakes often. He's also weirdly obsessed with AI.

Don't go to lectures just read the textbook and study from that and you"ll be fine
Quizzes are open book and based all on textbook material 
Exams are combo of textbook/lecture 
One-note, boring, unengaging speaker
Obsessed with AI 
Some questions on exams needed a lot of clarification and were confusing to everybody

Really sweet prof, truly cares about the students and will take time to talk to them. Really tries to make class engaging through class discussions. 3 exams non-cumulative and weekly open book quizzes. Covers a lot of material but isn't too unbearable with his jokes and consistent breaks. Passionate about gen AI and often brings it up.

Really nice guy who cares about students. Reasonable and generous marker on assignments/tests. No final exam, just 3 midterms and a short paper. He was a very passionate lecturer and made topics relevant and interesting. He uses a textbook, but I don't think it is necessary for success as long as you pay attention and study lectures.

Really nice guy, got the vibe he actually cares about students. Passionate about topics, and is really good at making information relevant. Generous and reasonable with test/assignment grading. I recommend the textbook if you want to go above and beyond, but as long as you go to lectures and pay attention, you will do well.
Standard psych class, read the textbook and do well. Going to lecture and reading notes is probably just as effective
